issues.title: Missing Notification Requirements for Supplemental Instruction Programs
issues.description: California Education Code requires districts to notify parents/guardians about supplemental instruction programs and their child's eligibility. The policy and regulation lack specific notification procedures, timelines, and content requirements that must be provided to parents when their child is identified for or enrolled in supplemental instruction programs.

legal_citations.text: The governing board of a school district shall notify the parent or guardian of a pupil who is required to attend supplemental instruction pursuant to this section.

issues.required_language: The district shall notify parents/guardians in writing when their child is identified for or required to participate in supplemental instruction programs. The notification shall include the reason for the recommendation, the program description, schedule, and the parent's right to request a conference to discuss the placement.

issues.title: Missing Assessment and Progress Monitoring Requirements
issues.description: Education Code requires districts to assess student progress in supplemental instruction programs and report results. Neither the policy nor regulation addresses how student progress will be measured, documented, or reported to parents during supplemental instruction programs.

legal_citations.text: The governing board shall ensure that the progress of pupils enrolled in supplemental instruction is monitored and that parents or guardians are notified of their child's progress.

issues.required_language: The district shall monitor and assess student progress in supplemental instruction programs through regular evaluations. Parents/guardians shall be notified of their child's progress at regular intervals, including specific information about academic gains and areas needing continued support.

issues.title: Missing Teacher Qualification Requirements
issues.description: Education Code specifies qualification requirements for teachers providing supplemental instruction. Neither document addresses the required qualifications, training, or certification requirements for staff delivering supplemental instruction programs.

legal_citations.text: Supplemental instruction shall be provided by teachers who meet the requirements of Section 44258.9 or other certificated employees.

issues.required_language: Supplemental instruction shall be provided by teachers who hold appropriate teaching credentials and meet the requirements of Education Code 44258.9, or by other certificated employees with appropriate training in the subject areas being taught.

issues.title: Outdated Legal References
issues.description: The documents reference the state exit examination and related Education Code sections that are no longer current. The California High School Exit Examination was suspended, and these references should be updated to reflect current graduation requirements and assessments.

legal_citations.text: The California High School Exit Examination requirements were suspended and later repealed. Current graduation requirements are found in Education Code 51225.3.

issues.required_language: References to the state exit examination should be updated to reflect current state assessment and graduation requirements, including CAASPP assessments and local graduation requirements pursuant to Education Code 51225.3.

issues.title: Missing Program Evaluation Requirements
issues.description: While not explicitly required by statute, best practices and accountability standards suggest that districts should evaluate the effectiveness of supplemental instruction programs. Neither document addresses program evaluation or effectiveness measures.

legal_citations.text: School districts shall evaluate the effectiveness of programs and services provided to students, including supplemental and remedial instruction programs.

issues.required_language: The district shall periodically evaluate the effectiveness of supplemental instruction programs, including analysis of student outcomes, program completion rates, and academic progress measures.
